titleStmt.title: The examination of Tilenus before the triers; in order to his intended settlement in the office of a publick preacher in the Common-wealth of Utopia. Whereunto are annexed the tenents of the remonstrants touching those five articles voted, stated and imposed, but not disputed, at the synod of Dort. Together with a short essay (by way of annotations) upon the fundamental theses of Mr. Thomas Parker.
titleStmt.author: Womock, Laurence, 1612-1685.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for R. Royston at the Angel in Ivie-Lane,

notesStmt.note: Preface signed: N.N., i.e. Laurence Womock.
First three words of half-title in Greek characters.

"The five articles controverted betwixt the remonstrants, and contra-remonstrants" and "Annotata quædam in fundamentales Mri Thomæ Parkeri theses" each have divisional title page; pagination and register are continuous. The latter consists of annotations on Parker's "Methodus gratiæ divinæ in traductione hominis peccatoris ad vitam".
With a final advertisement leaf; the last leaf is blank.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Dec 10"; the 8 in the imprint date has been crossed out and replaced with a "7".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
